entry.title: Direct reflections from ICFP 2018
entry.summary: I spent a week at the main functional programming conference and got to talk to my heroes, so here are some reflections.

entry.title: The diacritic omission phenomenon
entry.summary: Omitting the diacritics is a common phenomenon in languages such as Turkish and Serbo-Croatian. Then why isn't there any research on this?

entry.title: Scoped implicit conversions for Idris
entry.summary: The Idris community is not so fond of implicit conversions, I think they're a useful and powerful tool that are easy to misuse. Here's an idea to fix them.

entry.title: Writing a Template Haskell library for GHC.Proof
entry.summary: GHC.Proof is a great hack and I wanted to add another hack on top of it. It is simple enough that it could serve as a Template Haskell tutorial for others.

entry.title: Switching to Kinesis Advantage
entry.summary: My new keyboard and related workflow changes

entry.title: Starting a Haskell student forum at Wesleyan
entry.summary: I will be giving lectures on Functional Programming in Haskell next semester.

entry.title: Language immersion for linguistic freaks
entry.summary: My reflection on how I felt when I was adapting to an English-speaking environment.

entry.title: An impractical pseudo-Prolog
entry.summary: I built a pseudo-Prolog that tries to answer queries by building the least Herbrand model, as a final project for a class. I chose to build it in Haskell to take advantage of lazy evaluations, but even then I couldn't handle infinite sets.

entry.title: Testing the waters with poetry translation
entry.summary: I translated a couple of famous Turkish poems to English. It turns out that translation is fun and tough. I'll also ramble a bit about adaptation to the US.

entry.title: Hakyll seems awesome
entry.summary: I started a blog with Hakyll.
